    It’s the little things that trip you up, right? Turns out it’s not super easy to just output curly brackets / braces in combination with % symbols in Jekyll, which uses Liquid templates, for the not-crazy reason that these are used for its templating language. About Me

I’m a dude who needs to write stuff down to remember it. (Seriously: how many times have I had to look up how to change the settings on a VPS to stop timing out my SSH connections so soon?)

I had the immense good fortune to study philosophy and the great books at St. John’s College (I even had my first web job there as their student webmaster). I’ve spent over five years as a full-time front-end developer and web designer (in varying proportions), and consider myself damned lucky. This is a good trade, folks.
